_header: O thou Fortune which hast the governance
Note:
Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 268-9.
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Grenoble, Bibl. municipale, Grenoble 873: (?) said to be ed. Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 268-9.
_description: Charles d’Orléans, a Compleynt — four stanzas rhyme royal with refrain, ‘Why wyltow not wythstand myn heuynesse’

BodFair16.First Lines:
O thou ffortune whyche hast the gouernaunceOf alle thynges kyndly
                    mevyng to and fro…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…ffor thys thou doost of very wylfulnesseWhy wyltow not
                    wythstand myn heuuynesse

BNfr25458.First Lines:
[O] thou fortune which hast the gouernnanceOf alle thynges kyndely
                    meuyng to se fro…
BNfr25458.Last Lines:
…For thys thou doste of verrey wylfulnesWhy wylt thou not
                    wythstand myn heuynes
